title: Freedmen's Bureau Records: J. N. Gentry to Frederick S. Tukey, September 14, 1867
summary: J. N. Gentry writes to the Staunton Bureau Agent (although he addressed the letter to Frederick Tukey, Tukey had been replaced by Thomas Jackson in April 1867), to state what he knows about a case in which two men claim to be married to the woman whom he employs.
keywords: Family, Property, Women, American Civil War
